result.execSummary:
All charges against Sarah L. Champion in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sarah L. Champion is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah L. Champion

records.addlTxt: 1:44 PM Defendant Sarah L. Champion in court.  Attorney Michelle M Brandemuehl in court for Sarah L. Champion.  Attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders case dismissed on States motion.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:33 AM Defendant Sarah L. Champion in court.  Attorney Michelle M Brandemuehl in court for Sarah L. Champion.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to participate in Deferred Prosecution Program. Defendant pleads not guilty.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: C.M.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:40 AM Defendant Sarah L. Champion appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: C.M. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse by September 2, 2022.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
